citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Environmental Satellite, Data and Information Service (NESDIS), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC)
citeinfo.title: Beaufort Sea - Alaska USGS Open File 83-706*

descript.abstract: The National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC) and the World Data Center A for Glaciology**** jointly announce the availability of data from two ice-gouge studies in the Beaufort Sea, Alaska. The studies were conducted by scientists with the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and contain data, interpreted from side-scan sonar, on the size, density, location, seawater depth, orientation of dominant and subordinate gouges, number, depth, frequency, width, and other relevant data for ice gouges in the Beaufort Sea. The large size of the data set has required computer-assisted methods for the analysis and correlation of the ice-gouge characteristics. The data are available as two tape files. File 1 contains 2,071 records of data for the Beaufort Sea shelf west of the Canning River (USGS Open File Report 81-950).** File 2 contains 372 records of data for the Beaufort Sea shelf east of the Canning River (USGS Open File Report 82-974).
descript.purpose: A report on the BEAUFORT SEA - ALASKA USGS Open File 83-706*

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
